{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2975571,"name":"Uddish Sood","username":"Bunny","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/3d9bf3/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-11-08T23:58:47.460Z","cooked":"

We have a problem with the connection fr the pcm to the compressor. The pcm does not read. We have plugged in everything and there is a true loop shown in the console, but no indication light. The compressor doesn‚Äôt turn on when the bot does.

20211108_1752233024√ó4032 2.19 MB

We have tested everything seperately. The everything is powered except the pneumatics. They work with a thrifty throttle though.

We have been using the user‚Äôs guide for pcm but can‚Äôt figure it out. Does anyone have an idea of what the problem is. Thanks in advance

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2021-11-08T23:58:47.460Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":40,"reads":138,"readers_count":137,"score":227.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":397152,"topic_slug":"need-some-more-help-this-time-with-the-pcm","display_username":"Uddish Sood","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/c/a/cae3f78165d9b6806e2eb56330665dff93d5ce2b.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49618,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/need-some-more-help-this-time-with-the-pcm/397152/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2975573,"name":"Jason Daming","username":"jdaming","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jdaming/{size}/137720_2.png","created_at":"2021-11-09T00:07:09.620Z","cooked":"

So to be clear the compressor won‚Äôt turn on till the robot is enabled. Have you enabled the robot?

Assuming you have enabled the robot can you use a multimeter to probe the compressor out lines?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2021-11-09T00:07:09.620Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":120,"readers_count":119,"score":34.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":397152,"topic_slug":"need-some-more-help-this-time-with-the-pcm","display_username":"Jason Daming","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18342,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Developer (Documentation), CSA"},"post_url":"/t/need-some-more-help-this-time-with-the-pcm/397152/2","custom_user_title":"WPILib Developer (Documentation), CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2975580,"name":"Tom","username":"Zook","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zook/{size}/252720_2.png","created_at":"2021-11-09T00:17:33.246Z","cooked":"

Crazy. We have an almost identical problem. Popped up in last match at Beach Blitz this weekend. Since we had no more matches we figured we‚Äôd wait until Tuesday meeting to figure it out.

  • No COMP light
  • all wires are good
  • enabled robot has no compressor running
  • solenoids all click when correct buttons pressed.

Is there a floating ground on channel 1? It sort of looks that way. I am not sure that would cause this though.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2021-11-09T00:29:37.225Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":105,"readers_count":104,"score":41.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":397152,"topic_slug":"need-some-more-help-this-time-with-the-pcm","display_username":"Uddish Sood","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":30291,"username":"Mr.R_2","name":"Mr.R^2","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mr.r_2/{size}/89723_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49618,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/need-some-more-help-this-time-with-the-pcm/397152/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2975590,"name":"Ari Meles-Braverman","username":"AriMB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arimb/{size}/189989_2.png","created_at":"2021-11-09T00:46:52.862Z","cooked":"

If you run a self-test on the PCM in the phoenix tuner does it say that the compressor is enabled? If it does and the compressor still isn‚Äôt turning on chances are your PCM is broken. If it‚Äôs not enabled, then you should check the pressure switch wiring to make sure it‚Äôs triggering properly

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2021-11-09T00:46:52.862Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":101,"readers_count":100,"score":40.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":397152,"topic_slug":"need-some-more-help-this-time-with-the-pcm","display_username":"Ari Meles-Braverman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25012,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/need-some-more-help-this-time-with-the-pcm/397152/7","custom_user_title":"FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2975592,"name":"Mr.R^2","username":"Mr.R_2","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mr.r_2/{size}/89723_2.png","created_at":"2021-11-09T00:49:50.443Z","cooked":"

There were two causes of this behavior that happened to us. I am relatively certain neither apply, but tossing them out in case it can help.

  1. The pressure switch was not wored correctly.
  2. We had not instantiated any valves correctly in our code.
","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2021-11-09T01:07:41.688Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":100,"readers_count":99,"score":30.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":397152,"topic_slug":"need-some-more-help-this-time-with-the-pcm","display_username":"Mr.R^2","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30291,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/need-some-more-help-this-time-with-the-pcm/397152/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2975593,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2021-11-09T01:06:36.937Z","cooked":"

image900√ó361 55.7 KB

What is the STATUS LED doing? Blinking? Colors?

image796√ó119 36 KB

Is the COMP LED turning green? If so, check the compressor outputs with a multimeter ‚Äì should see 12V. If not, try shorting the two ‚ÄúPRESSURE SW‚Äù with a jumper temporarily. This eliminates the pressure switch and wiring as suspects. BE SURE TO LEAVE THE PRESSURE RELIEF VALVE OPEN when doing this!

Be sure the PCM shows up in the Phoenix Tuner utility. Note this link has troubleshooting steps.

(More detailed info on the LED states is here ‚Äì section 4.1 is about troubleshooting this specific issue.)

def robotInit(self):
    # pneumatics solenoids
    self.hatchcover = wpilib.DoubleSolenoid(0,1)

Is it just that part of the CAN bus wire isn‚Äôt twisted or is the entire CAN bus wire that goes off to the right are not in a twisted pair configuration???

Also make sure that your pressure switch is operational (swap to a different if necessary as a quick test).

[Changed order]
Not likely, but check that your system isn‚Äôt already pressurized.
If it is, depressurize it and see if this solves the problem.

tkchan:

Also make sure that your pressure switch is operational (swap to a different if necessary as a quick test).

Alternately, just insert the same piece of wire in both pressure switch connectors. Don‚Äôt run the system like this longer than needed to verify that this is the issue!
